title: Pressure grows on regulators to reform fund management industry in wake of Woodford scandal
text:
Britain's financial watchdog is under mounting pressure to impose sweeping reforms of the fund management industry, after the implosion of Neil Woodford’s investment empire left ­ordinary investors facing steep losses.

Ian Sayers, head of the influential ­investor group the Association of ­Investment Companies (AIC) urged regulators at the Financial Conduct ­Authority (FCA) to tighten rules on open ended funds “as soon as possible”.

He warned that a “fire is breaking out” in the sector because of what he described as “dodgy electrics” – or a weak regulatory framework.
